KSP : 1.04 Windows 32-bits

Mods : ![LWw52tC.png](http://i.imgur.com/LWw52tC.png)

Reproduction steps : Place a command pod/probe (any), a battery (any, with <100% Electric Charge) and a solar panel (any). Launch at KSC during day, extend solar panel if needed, watch batteries not recharching despite solar panels getting sun exposure.

I tried with the rocket that failed, then with a OKTO + battery + solar panel, then I tried to replace the OKTO with a MK1 Command pod : no success.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-16T13:37:45Z" title="07/16/2015 01:37  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 16, 2015</time> by AzertyBot**

I believe this is a known issue with a certain recent version of Kopernicus and a fix is available from their [thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649-1-0-4-Kopernicus-Beta-%280-2-2%29-July-7-Hotfix%21?highlight=kopernicus).

That was it, now working perfectly.

Thank you very much for the fast answer !
